match_info.title: India vs Pakistan, 27th Match, Group A, ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026
match_info.toss: Pakistan won the toss and opt to Bowl

batters.name: Abhishek Sharma
batters.dismissal_info: c Shaheen Afridi b Salman Agha

batters.name: Suryakumar Yadav
batters.dismissal_info: c Saim Ayub b Usman Tariq

batters.name: Hardik Pandya
batters.dismissal_info: c Babar Azam b Saim Ayub

batters.name: Axar Patel
batters.dismissal_info: c Saim Ayub b Shaheen Afridi

balls.commentary: some turn! 91kph, lands it on a good length and it straightens a touch around off, Kishan defends forward
Kishan goes on the attack! Looks to step out, the ball is fired in slightly short and he drags the pull to deep midwicket
91.4kph, fired in on a good length just outside off, Abhishek cuts well but finds extra cover
good control from Salman so far. Another one on a good length, slides in on off and middle, Abhishek clears the front leg and drives straight to extra cover
flat length ball outside off, 90kph, Abhishek cuts it straight to cover

Salman opening the bowling has turned out to be a masterstroke. Duck in the opening game, and another duck today for Abhishek. Yet to open his account in this tournament. It's flat and sliding in at the stumps, probably not short enough to pull, he goes for it anyway and miscues it to mid-on. Right off the splice and no power behind it at all. What a start for Pakistan. Salman immediately points in the direction of one of his teammates, someone who suggested the move to him perhaps? He said in the presser yesterday that he wants Abhishek to play, and now he's got rid of him. Abhishek Sharma c Shaheen Afridi b Salman Agha 0(4)

he couldn't have struck that any better! Right off the screws from Ishan Kishan as he pulls Shaheen's first ball into the crowd. It's dug in on a short of length, Kishan gets into good position, transfers his weight back and nails it over square leg
nearly dragged on! Again he goes for the pull but the ball isn't as short this time. It's back of a length, Kishan gets a thick under-edge and it runs away past the stumps
slower short ball outside off, Kishan drags the pull away to deep backward square
cutting in from back of a length, 140kph, Tilak hangs back and defends from the crease
full and swinging away outside off, Tilak opens the face and guides it to backward point

edged and four! Cracking outswinger from Shaheen! Fuller than a good length outside off, shapes away, draws Tilak into a tentative poke and his feet have gone nowhere. Healthy edge goes past the fielder at wide slip
Salman misses his length and is punished. Nothing was in the slot in his previous over, but this one is. Kishan spots it early, clears the front leg and smokes it over mid-on
dances down but the length is pulled back and he's nowhere to the pitch of it. Tries working it through the on-side but is hit on the pad as it slides in with the arm
down on one knee for the sweep, takes a thick top-edge over square leg, back for a couple of runs as the fielder chases it down
pushed through flat on a good length, Kishan steps out, doesn't meet the pitch and just nudges it into the on-side
95kph, slides in off a good length and Tilak gently tucks it into the midwicket region

sliced in the air and Kishan gets away with it! Not a great shot. Tossed up outside off, the line is pretty wide and he's looking to go for a big sweep. Length is a bit shorter than ideal too. He fails to get on top of it and slices it in front of long-off. The ball drops well short of the fielder
flat-batted straight back to Ayub. Probably held up in the pitch and he had to check his shot. Fell just short of the bowler there

flat and slightly short outside off, Kishan looks to cut but it holds in the pitch again. Tackiness in the pitch is evident. This is why Pakistan opted to bowl. He ends up chopping it into the off-side
this one sits up nicely for him. Short on middle and leg, Kishan rocks back and pulls over square leg. He's off to a brisk start again!
cuts this well but straight to cover

dragged down short outside off, it's swatted back down the pitch and Tilak fails to get out of the way! Was struck very hard by Kishan but straight into the feet of his partner. Thankfully the pad was there to save him some pain

dive saves Kishan! Flat and short, he looks to pull but has to check his shot as it holds on him. Ends up tapping it to mid-on and sets off for the run. The fielder makes a direct hit but Kishan is home
Kishan greets Abrar the same way he greeted Shaheen, smashing the first ball for six. It's down the leg-side, poor delivery and he sweeps it hard over backward square. Sails over the ropes!
down leg again, this time he misses the sweep and it's off the pad to the keeper who fumbles

finds the right line and length. Pushed through flat on off, turns in off a good length and Kishan is cramped on the cut. Didn't read which way it was going to turn perhaps? Ends up chopping it to short third
this time he has enough time on the back foot to read it off the pitch. Googly outside off, it's short and wide and Kishan slaps it through the covers
round the wicket goes Abrar now. It's a googly floated up nicely, dips on Kishan as he advances and forces him to adjust in defence. Off a thick inside edge it goes into the on-side
tossed up on off, another googly perhaps, Tilak defends forward. Hasn't had much strike in this partnership with Kishan going great guns
tossed up outside off, it's an offbreak that turns away off a good length, Kishan goes back and punches down to long-off
oh a reverse-hit attempted by Tilak, but he's through the shot too early. Was nicely tossed up from round the wicket, beats Tilak in the flight and he gets it off the toe-end in front of cover
length ball turning away from off, defended from the crease
almost gets out the same way Abhishek did. Goes back to pull, gets it high on the bat and miscues it in the air. But he gets just enough to clear the mid-on fielder

beaten in flight as he steps out. It turns away off a length and Kishan has to be sharp in order to keep it out. Does well with his reflexes, reaching out towards the ball and steering it through point

runs away off the edge past the keeper! Lovely from Ayub, slowing it up and getting it to dip on a good length. Tilak is on the forward stretch but still can't cover the pitch of the ball. The edge is found as it turns sharply, but there's no slip in place

what lovely batting. Great use of the hands to guide it past short third. Length ball turning in from round the wicket, it's just outside off and allows Kishan enough room to maneuver it with his wrists. Opens the face and runs it fine!

fifty off just 27 balls! The entire dugout stands up to applaud a superb knock as Kishan's dream run continues since coming back into the team. Floated up full, in the slot and he pumps it straight back over Abrar's head
now goes inside out. Length is the problem again here. Too full from Abrar, Kishan manages to get under it and smears it over extra cover
tries a late dab but can't get it past short third
turning in, tucking him up and he nudges it from the crease to short midwicket
slightly short at the stumps, pulled to deep midwicket for a single
Shadab starts the same way Abrar did, and he'll be glad to not get hammered into the crowd like him. Tossed up outside leg, Kishan sweeps along the floor to the left of deep backward square
this time he's not spared. A belligerent slog-sweep into the crowd from Ishan Kishan! Floated up on middle, right in the slot and he knocks the living daylights out of it
awful bowling. Down the leg-side, turning in further, a virtual free-hit for Kishan and he sweeps it hard behind square
dances down to the pitch of the ball and drills it down the ground. Takes a tumbling stop from Shaheen at long-on to cut it off

he's just doing what he wants. The bowlers are at his mercy. Slow and tossed up at the stumps, he goes reverse, loses his balance but drags it past short third. Fielder got a hand diving across, took the pace off it, allowing it to be cut off in the deep
slightly short, he rocks back for the pull and mistimes it through midwicket
goes for the pull but the ball stops and turns sharply. Miscues it in the air through midwicket. No one in the circle there
sliding in on leg, slightly short, Tilak bends his knee and pulls gently to deep backward square
the issue on his right leg hasn't stopped him from going for the reverse-hit again. Doesn't go down on the knees this time, stands tall and swats it over backward point

Pakistan can breathe a huge sigh of relief! Ayub puts his arms up as the dangerous Ishan Kishan is knocked over. What a knock though. On a challenging surface, he has hammered 77 off just 40 balls to put India ahead at this stage. Has completely defied the conditions. Deserves an applause as he walks off and the crowd obliges. This one is nicely bowled by Ayub. Slows it down at 84kph, lands it on a good length and Kishan has backed away too far to the leg-side. The ball grips, turns away and he's unable to reach out with his weight leaning back. It clips the top of middle and leg, dislodging the bail from its groove. Ishan Kishan b Saim Ayub 77(40) [4s-10 6s-3]
dipping legbreak outside off, Surya isn't in control as he punches in the air through cover
sharp turn off a good length, Tilak watches it carefully and defends from the crease
drifting in on middle, full ball, Surya pushes gently to short extra cover
too full, driven to long-off
length ball wide of off, Tilak bends his knees, gets low and cuts it to deep point
good length on middle, not much turn, Surya defends from the crease into the off-side
lands it on a good length again, it's on middle and Surya opens the face, tapping it through point
floated up on off, 86kph, Tilak gets forward and defends to short cover
Tariq's first ball disappears to the boundary! An off-break turning in off a good length, Surya waits in the crease before whipping it through the gap at midwicket
turning the other away this time, good length ball, Surya opens the face and punches through the covers
big pause in delivery, googly from round the wicket, it drifts into the pads and Tilak nudges in front of short midwicket
turning in towards off, good length ball, defended forward
now the one turning away and Tilak doesn't pick it. Dips on a good length, he gets forward but is beaten on the edge as it turns away
googly on off, drops it short but Tilak doesn't get his timing right on the pull. Drags it gently through square leg

a shot that gets Tilak going? Has been subdued so far, didn't get much strike in the partnership with Kishan and now strikes his first six. It's tossed up wide of off, he reaches out, goes inside-out and carves it over extra cover. The timing takes it all the way!
sharp turn off a length, Tilak tries clipping it away but is hit on the pad. Missing leg comfortably, no appeal
flat length ball turning in on off, Tilak taps it against the turn through point
good length on middle and leg, slow through the air, Surya nudges it from the crease through midwicket
fired in full on off, 97kph, driven to long-off

1 run, huge appeal for LBW as Surya misses the sweep. Dharmasena says not out and Pakistan go for the review. Surya was beaten by the slowness of the delivery. Through the shot early, it pitches behind his legs, hits the back leg and up goes Nawaz. Has that straightened enough or is it sliding on to miss leg stump. Looks close. Oh ball-tracking says it's only clipping leg stump. Didn't straighten enough and will stay with umpire's call
length ball turning in on off, driven firmly on the up through extra cover and it takes a sliding stop in the deep to cut it off
fired in full just outside off, Tilak gets forward and drives to long-off
flat and slightly short outside off, Surya flat-bats to long-on
slow googly floated up outside off, Tilak reaches out and drives to long-off
turning down leg, Suryakumar misses the flick and it's called wide
the legbreak, lands it on a good length around off, turns away and Surya cuts well. Takes a good stop from Shadab at backward point
good length outside off, enough width on offer for Tilak who executes the late-cut nicely, hitting it to the left of short third
swept away nicely but fielder at deep backward square leg dives around to cut it off. Was a full ball and SKY wanted to pierce the gap at deep square
oh wanted to force it off the back foot but got rushed by this flatter delivery from round the wicket, inside edge onto pad and rolling to mid-wicket
stays leg-side now to access the off-side, SKY pushes it to short cover sans timing

now SKY goes behind square with the sweep and Shadab makes a mess of it at the deep backward square leg fence. He was lazy to bend and he couldn't handle the last second spin when it bounced just in front of him. Body not behind the line so the ball escapes for four. SKY jumps inside the line for this sweep, gets it over the infield and gets some spin on the shot as well to fool the fielder in the deep
flatter delivery, SKY knocks it to deep mid-wicket
turning back in, Tilak watchfully tucks to mid-wicket
flatter delivery turning away a bit, SKY chops the late cut to short third man. Usman Khan breaks the stumps without collecting the throw. Tilak was home though

He's missed it and that's plumb. Full and on the stumps, Tilak went for the sweep. Too full for the shot? No seems like it just bounced over the bat with some turn as Tilak was through the shot early. Impact in line with middle stump from round the wicket and when that happens it means it's straightened enough for the finger to go up. Tilak walks off without wasting the review. Ball-tracker says ball hitting a decent part of leg stump (ump's call) so he would have been out anyway. Tilak Varma lbw b Saim Ayub 25(24) [4s-2 6s-1]

This is highhh, is it long? Nooo! Hardik has been attacking the spinner straightaway these days. He chanced his arm given that his team is in a strong position. But he mishit this carrom ball. Wise of Saim Ayub to bowl it wide of off and make Hardik fetch the loft. Ball went off the bottom of the bat and into orbit. Long-off judged it really well into his hands and Saim Ayub is on a hat-trick. He is pumped. He gives Hardik a bit of a sendoff. Hardik Pandya c Babar Azam b Saim Ayub 0(1)

great hat-trick ball from Saim Ayub. Sucked Dube into a front foot push and Dube isn't one to move his feet nicely towards the pitch of the bat. A tentative defence, ball turned square after pitching around middle and leg. Turn was good but the bounce helped Dube escaped from being bowled. Ball jumped over the off stump. Emotional appeal from the keeper and tricked his captain into a review, only to lose it as UltraEdge was silent when the ball went past the bat
Dube is searching for the ball off the pitch, squared up but he manages to defend
flatter delivery, Dube knocks it to mid-wicket and he is off the mark
flighted delivery on the stumps, Dube gets low and looks for the slogsweep, off the thick inside half and down to deep backward square-leg
full delivery, SKY walks into the flick and wrists it to deep mid-wicket
flatter delivery, Dube calmly nudges to long-on
SKY bends his knees to get under the ball but Mohammad Nawaz shortens the length and forces a gentle push through cover-point

he's managed to force the pull off the back foot. Didn't middle it all that well but got it in the gap at square leg. Two men in the deep are split to perfection. Nawaz tried to drop it short but Dube was on the back foot to execute the boundary
slapped away through cover
pauses and delivers this flat, Dube delays the bat swing and mistimes the slog along the ground to long-on
gets it turn back in sharply to cramp SKY on the late cut, SKY managed to slice it to backward point. Was the googly in fact
oh he wanted to hit over backward square leg but the ball flies off the bottom of the bat and clears mid-wicket. Excites the keeper as he shouts "catch, catch" but there was no one
shortish delivery on the stumps, Dube mistimes the slog to deep mid-wicket
oh smart bowling! Saw SKY moves across a long way and fired this flat wide of off stump. Ball kept low to beat the Indian captain on the cut. Not called a wide because SKY moved a fair distance
very full, SKY drills it to long-on and just 4 runs off the over

oh what a shot! So difficult to play a straight-batted back foot loft on this pitch. The ball was quick so he had no time, yet he managed to get under the ball, hold a high elbow and pierce the gap between deep mid-wicket and long-on
knocked around to deep mid-wicket
Dube tries to break free, goes hard on the pull, hits it flat and goes on the bounce to deep mid-wicket to the left
turning away outside off stump, SKY drives to deep point

that's what Dube can do! Just one loose ball is all he wanted. Abrar Ahmed dropped it short even though he got some turn on it. Dube loves to hang back so it was an easy pull shot for him over deep mid-wicket for a much needed maximum
quicker delivery on the stumps, Dube flicks to deep mid-wicket
slow and turning away, Dube looks to cut, inside edge onto pad

he steps out and belts Usman Tariq over his head towards the sightscreen. Good use of the feet to put the bowler off his lengths. You don't see Dube stepping out often but that's what Usman Tariq has forced him to do with the pause. He got to the pitch of the ball and smashed it straight
1 run, oh missed out there. Dube was ready to smash this pull over long leg but couldn't get under the ball, brushed the leg and rolled behind square
SKY moves across and tries to sweep over short fine leg but Usman Tariq got this to turn away and beat the bat

Finally Usman Tariq gets a wicket off the penultimate ball of his spell. He might not have been in the wickets but he's had a great impact with his economy. He paused to deliver this flatter delivery. SKY moved across to slog this over mid-wicket. Mistimed the shot and the big boundaries at RPS ensures it's not going all the way. Saim Ayub seemed to have misjudged that a wee bit but he managed to pouch it in the end. Suryakumar Yadav c Saim Ayub b Usman Tariq 32(29) [4s-3]
oh Rinku aimed mid-wicket, ball went back to the bowler. Full delivery, Rinku went for a might slog-sweep, toe-ender rolls to the bowler

but Shaheen Afridi dishes out a slower delivery right in the slot for Dube to belt down the ground. Picked the slower ball early, waited to bring his bat down and drilled that hard along the ground for a boundary pretty straight
now he mistimes the loft along the ground to long-off

what was that? He just casually played with one hand and managed to get four for it! Slower delivery into the wicket, sat up and had a lot of width. Rinku was early into the shot to the bottom hand came off the handle. He went for a slap with one hand and sliced it over backward point
this guy is a great finisher if you offer pace. Absolute slot ball from Shaheen Afridi as he misses the yorker. Rinku gets under it and smokes it high and handsome over mid-wicket

1 run completed. Oh confusion and Dube is out. Rinku slapped this short of length delivery over cover. Sweeper cuts it off. Dube thought the second was on so he charged. Rinku said no and Dube had to reverse and stretch full length. Nawaz fired a good throw to the keeper who caught him well short. Dube not happy with Rinku. Did he stretch his hamstring? But he seems fine as he jogs off the field. The third ump wasn't needed. Shivam Dube run out (Mohammad Nawaz/Usman Khan) 27(17) [4s-3 6s-1]

Axar Patel loses shape on the slog, the bat turns in his hands and deep mid-wicket runs in to take a great diving catch. Just 1 run off the last 2 balls and that will please Pakistan. Shaheen went for a full delivery, was there to be hit but the connection wasn't right from Axar. Axar Patel c Saim Ayub b Shaheen Afridi 0(1)

batters.name: Sahibzada Farhan
batters.dismissal_info: c Rinku Singh b Hardik Pandya

batters.name: Salman Agha
batters.dismissal_info: c Hardik Pandya b Jasprit Bumrah

batters.name: Usman Khan
batters.dismissal_info: st Ishan Kishan b Axar Patel

batters.name: Shadab Khan
batters.dismissal_info: c Shivam Dube b Tilak Varma

batters.name: Mohammad Nawaz
batters.dismissal_info: c Shivam Dube b Kuldeep Yadav

batters.name: Faheem Ashraf
batters.dismissal_info: c Rinku Singh b Varun Chakaravarthy

balls.commentary: gentle away swing from Hardik Pandya, Sahibzada defends off the back foot
moves across to access the leg-side, Hardik drags his length back and forces a gentle flick to mid-wicket
short of length delivery moving away outside off stump, Sahibzada drives to cover

This is a body blow for Pakistan. Sahibzada Farhan was Pakistan's best bet to attack Bumrah - he's smashed Bumrah in the past but India have stumped the opener by giving the new ball to Hardik. It had to be him given Arshdeep is not playing and full credit to Hardik for not giving a single freebie. Not easy to come in and hit the spots straightaway in a pressure game when you are not regularly bowling with the new ball. Ran in so well and dug this short of length delivery into the pitch with some away movement. Sahibzada Farhan goes for the pull, loses shape and top-edges high. Rinku settles under it at mid-on and celebrates with his arms aloft after taking a well judged catch. Sahibzada Farhan c Rinku Singh b Hardik Pandya 0(4)
squared up! Salman Agha got opened up by this away swinging short of length delivery, he walked for a push and got beaten
knocked to the on-side and Hardik Pandya begins with a wicket-maiden. He blows a flying kiss to someone in the crowd

in the airrrrr but he clears third man. Saim Ayub had no clue what this ball was doing and where it went. Short of a length delivery swinging away outside off stump, Saim advanced to slog, top edge flew as he played with his eyes closed

Genius of a full inswinger from Jasprit Bumrah. Saim Ayub again didn't expect Bumrah to swing it full into him. He was so late on the shot as he went a bit across the line. The ball thudded the front pad in line with middle stump before he could get his bat down or move his leg away. Bumrah knew he had his man. Confident appeal and umpire Kumar Dharmasena took a while before nodding in favour of the bowler. Saim sent it upstairs and took the review with him. Pakistan in trouble Saim Ayub lbw b Jasprit Bumrah 6(2) [6s-1]
short of length delivery outside off stump, Babar cuts and just clears backward point. But it's cut off in the deep though
dabbed to third man

it's Varun giving chase from mid-wicket and he's never going to stop that. Full and swinging back in, Salman looks to flick, ball dragged off the inside half of the bat and it escapes to the right of Varun

That is an awful shot. Absolute soft dismissal. He planted his front leg across the line and then he tried to flick over mid-wicket. Mike Hesson will not be happy. Poor from the Pakistani captain. Jasprit Bumrah got this short of length delivery to angle in and cut back into the RHB. Salman was in no position to flick. Leading edge flew high and Hardik moved a few paces back at mid-on to take an easy catch. You can't give two wickets this early to Bumrah and win a game. Salman Agha c Hardik Pandya b Jasprit Bumrah 4(4) [4s-1]
oh thick edge flies through the vacant short third man as Babar looks to drive this outie
good length delivery just outside off stump, Usman pushes it to the left of the bowler
advances and looks to slog, mistimes it to Varun at mid-wicket as he loses shape on the shot. Hardik smartly bowls into the wicket

that's a lovely lofted drive! Stood leg-side of this full outswinger. First real bad ball from Hardik you could say because the length was full and in the slot. Usman played straight through the line and cleared not just mid-off but the long-off fence as well
immediately Hardik drags his length back and beats the bat! Short of a length, Usman looks to pull, surprised by the length so he missed
slower delivery outside off stump, Usman cuts hard. Great diving save at backward point to save a certain four
good length delivery, Usman manages to keep it out
now he manages to nudge to mid-wicket and get off strike
sprays this down the leg-side, possibly looking for LBW/bowled
short of length delivery just outside off stump, Babar knocks it with soft hands to point and sets off for a quick single
Bumrah aims for the toes and Usman almost loses his footing as he hurriedly tried to get the legs out of the way and get bat on this 145kph yorker. Dug out through square leg
slower delivery, Babar didn't pick it, slightly early but he only pushed with soft hands so it rolled to cover
beats the bat! Short of a length delivery outside off stump, Babar looks to cut but misses
flatter delivery on the stumps, Usman defends to the left of the bowler
lovely shot! Axar Patel gave this a lot of air but he bowled too full. Usman backed away and got under this ball to loft inside out over cover-point for four

and again! This time goes straighter as Axar Patel bowls quicker. Stood leg-side of the ball and lofted over cover - inside-out again. Fielder at cover jumps but it clears him. Usman putting pressure back on India
flatter delivery, knocked to mid-wicket

There is a competition in the Pakistan dressing room between Salman Agha and Babar Azam for who played the worst shot of the night? If you thought Salman got out to a soft dismissal, Babar Azam has played an uncharacteristic slog and made a mess of his own stumps. Axar Patel has his arms aloft as he sees the middle stump disturbed. Pakistan are mentally just not in the contest at all. Flatter trajectory from Axar Patel that he bowls so well and cuts all room for the RHB. Babar tries to slog across the line and had no clue. Babar Azam b Axar Patel 5(7)
hits the pad but missing leg so India mute their own appeal. Slider from Axar Patel, Shadab looks to defend off the front foot, plays outside the line and escapes LBW
flatter delivery, Usman defends
in the airrr, doesn't carry to long-off. Full delivery from Varun, Usman backed himself to loft. Mistimed and escaped as there was a fielder on the fence
pushed along the ground to long-off
flatter delivery, Shadab nudges through mid-on
quickly rocks back to cut this flatter delivery to backward point. Didn't pick the gap so no runs there
again tries to cut but the ball jumps on him to force a mishit, played to cover-point
gets his foot across and kneels down to paddle this flatter delivery to fine leg
full and slow, he's is teasing Usman to take him on. Gentle psuh back to the bowler this time though
Usman advances and slogs hard, ball escapes off the inside half of the bat and clears mid-wicket. Long-on and deep mid-wicket were too far apart to cut this off
picks this up from the off stump, cut to backward point
hint of turn away from a good length outside off, Usman goes on the back foot, opens the face and dabs to short third
poor delivery and put away for four. It's sliding down leg, good length and glanced away wide of short fine
backs away and guides this flatter delivery through point. Oh they charge back for the third as well. Fifty up for Pakistan in 43 balls
turning away outside off stump, Usman taps it to cover
oh that's a full toss, Shadab reverse laps, beats short third man. Just guided that in the gap and gets four
flatter delivery just outside off stump, Shadab taps it to cover
flatter delivery just outside off stump, Usman cuts to backward point
oh backs away. Ball kept following him and cramped for room. Shadab tried to push it off the back foot to mid-off but gets an inside edge that rolls to the on-side

in the airrrr, just got a hand on it. Will go down as a chance. Tilak was very wide at long-off. Usman stepped out and mistimed the loft. Had Tilak been finer he would have taken this catch. He ran to the right, stretched full length but couldn't close his hands in time
now Usman smacks it over the bowler's head for four. Hit this very straight and ensured long-off and long-on had no chance. Good use of the feet and good connection too
flatter delivery, Usman advances and manages to get bat on ball to save his wicket from being stumped
wristed to mid-wicket
flatter delivery on the stumps, Shadab watchfully defends. Wasn't a confident defence though
he's not reading the sliders from Axar Patel, Shadab missed the flick, ball hit the pad and rolled to the on-side. Ball was well down the leg-side no chance of LBW
full and turning back in, Usman leans forward and drives to long-off
googly just outside off stump, Shadab punches it off the back foot to long-off
oh wanted a mighty heave across the line, Usman inside-edged it through backward square leg
beaten! Googly on a fullish length, Shadab caught on the crease pushin at the ball. Almost took the outside edge and Ishan took the bails off in case the foot went up
flatter delivery, Shadab flicks to mid-wicket
short and turning away, Usman didn't control the cut. Goes uppishly
he ran down the pitch way too early, Axar Patel darts it short and into the body, inside edge onto pad and rolling to the off-side
full delivery, Usman backs away and lose shape on the loft, mistimed to long-on
cramped for room again, Shadab flicks to mid-wicket

He was itching to attack Axar Patel and the bowler had a close eye on the batter as to what the trigger movement was. Usman left the crease a tad bit early. Axar fired this short and got some bounce on it to take it past Usman's aggressive slap. Ishan Kishan had to get his hands high to collect and he had enough time to ignite the stumps as Usman was a logn way out. So the lone Pakistan batter who looked like he could do something is gone. SKY gives Axar Patel a warm hug. In fact the UltraEdge replay shows a spike when the ball passed the bat so Usman edged that as well. Usman Khan st Ishan Kishan b Axar Patel 44(34) [4s-6 6s-1]
beaten! Plays inside the line of this flatter delivery and misses as he looks to defend
flatter delivery on the off stump, Nawaz defends
pushed square of the wicket for a run

full toss, Nawaz sweeps. Dube at deep mid-wicket had too much distance to cover to the left and Dube almost overbalanced when he was trying to give chase. SKY isn't happy. Is he disappointed with the full toss?
flat delivery, Nawaz pushes it back to the bowler

Dubeeee, takes a good catch running to the right at deep mid-wicket. Kuldeep Yadav gets a wicket off a full toss. Nawaz plays a half-hearted slog. Ended up just chipped it in the air. Dube judged it well to the right and it came at an awkward height - chest high - and he did well to close his bucket hands. While India celebrate the wicket. It's not often that you see Kuldeep bowl two full toss in an over! He seems a bit rusty? Mohammad Nawaz c Shivam Dube b Kuldeep Yadav 4(5) [4s-1]
turning away outside off stump, Faheem punches it towards point
leans forward and pushes it to the off-side

Pakistan are ending this early. Shadab backs himself to tee off as the offie comes on but this isn't a straightforward pitch. The bat turns in his hands on impact and long-off waits to pouch it clean. 78/7 - down and out! Shadab Khan c Shivam Dube b Tilak Varma 14(15) [4s-1]
round the wicket to the left-hander, Shaheen drives to long-off past the dive by SKY at cover
nice cover drive, straight to SKY at cover but looks like he's got hit on the shin. Grimaces but looks fine
nicely lofted over cover. Too full, Faheem gets under it and belts this over the infield and gets four
Tilak Varma yorks Faheem with a loopy ball, Faheem swings hard and gets an inside edge onto pad
flatter delivery, Faheem punches it to long-off
turning away, Faheem goes back and flicks to deep square leg
1 run, googly down the leg-side, Shaheen looks to glance, misses the flick and it goes off the pad to short fine leg
now it's well down the leg-side
turning away outside off stump, Faheem dabs to backward point
short and turning back in as Kuldeep Yadav bowls the googly, Faheem pulls without control over mid-wicket
turning away, slow turn, Shaheen watchfully knocks it to short mid-wicket
turning away outside off stump, Faheem defends off the back foot
flat good length on off, Shaheen Afridi goes on the back foot and knocks it back to Tilak Varma
tossed up full outside off, Shaheen Afridi shuffles across to slogsweep, the thick top-edge flies wide of Varun at short third
flat good length just outside off, Faheem Ashraf goes on the back foot and punches it hard and straight to long-off

dropped by Tilak going back. Full on middle, Shaheen Afridi gets forward to loft, skies it way up, Tilak goes back, hard hands and he drops it after getting both hands. Not an easy catch but should've been taken
fired full on the legs, Shaheen Afridi heaves it to deep square-leg
flat good length on middle, Faheem Ashraf goes on the back foot and punches it to the left of Tilak Varma who runs and dives to his left to cut it off. So much committment to save one run
tossed up full on middle, Shaheen Afridi gets forward to slogsweep and he finds long-on for one, didn't time it
tossed up full on middle, from round the wicket, Faheem Ashraf sinks low and slogsweeps wide of deep square-leg for two

India inch closer. It's a flat delivery on off and middle, Faheem Ashraf goes on the back foot to pull, mistimes it, Rinku comes in from deep mid-wicket and takes an easy catch. He was in a fair way from the fence. The Indian supporters in the stands having a jolly good time. Faheem Ashraf c Rinku Singh b Varun Chakaravarthy 10(14) [4s-1]

Plumb and umpire Kumar Dharmasena has an easy decision. It's the googly and one expected Varun Chakaravarthy to bowl it, Abrar Ahmed had no clue, it cuts back in from just outside off, raps the back pad as the bat is late to come down. Three reds and the review is lost. It hit the pad even before Abrar could get the bat in line. Varun on a hat-trick. Abrar Ahmed lbw b Varun Chakaravarthy 0(1)

SKY reviews for LBW. Let's see. Another googly and Usman Tariq with a crab-like forward defence, misses the push, hit on the front pad, above the kneeroll and it's missing. Too much bounce and India lose it. Easily missing leg-stump. SKY checked with everyone and went for it. The fielders crowded Tariq for the hat-trick ball and he had no clue of that googly
the pause delivery from Varun Chakaravarthy. Wry smile from him. It's a length delivery outside off, slides on, left alone and Ishan Kishan takes the bails off, but Tariq had gone nowhere
flat good length outside off, Shaheen Afridi backs away and thrashes it wide of extra-cover, races away giving long-off no chance to his left
fired down leg, Shaheen Afridi goes fora big slogsweep and misses, impact outside the leg-stump
full and drifting into middle, Shaheen Afridi sinks low and slogsweeps wide of short fine to his right, too much work for deep square-leg to do to his left, it runs away
slower and wider outside off, fuller too, Shaheen Afridi can't reach out as he gets forward to loft and misses, did well not to drag his back foot out as Ishan Kishan was quick
length delivery and flat outside off, Shaheen Afridi backs away to slug it hard and straight to long-on
full and fired in just outside off, Shaheen Afridi sinks low and drags the loft to long-on, just one
Shaheen Afridi backs away outside the leg-stump, Hardik Pandya tries to follow him with a short delivery there, Afridi ducks and it's called a wide for height, too short

is that a drop by Ishan Kishan? Yes it is. Hardik Pandya is not happy. He has a go at Ishan. Down leg, short, Shaheen Afridi comes down the track and pulls, off the glove and it loops to Ishan, easy catch and somehow he drops it

Kuldeep drops it now at long-on and Hardik Pandya goes after both Ishan Kishan and Kuldeep. A short of length delivery on off, Shaheen Afridi gets forward and pulls, Kuldeep is at the edge of the fence at long-on, he gets both hands and it drops beyond the cushions. Pandya points at both Ishan and Kuldeep and curses them with a couple of expletives thrown in for good measure in Hindi
short of length outside off, angling away from the left-hander, Shaheen Afridi slogs and misses
a low full-toss outside the leg-stump, Shaheen Afridi backs away and drives straight to the fielder at long-on
short of length on off, Shaheen Afridi goes on the back foot and pulls straight to the fielder at deep mid-wicket, just one

That should cool down Hardik Pandya. He has been ticking this over after the drops by Ishan and Kuldeep. He still is having a go at Kuldeep. He is not happy at all. Usman Tariq doesn't get in line to this full delivery, he pushes at it, the middle-stump is knocked back. Pandya kept it on the stumps and Tariq helped him a lot by backing away. India have hammered Pakistan in an ICC event again. So what's new? Usman Tariq b Hardik Pandya 0(3)
